meanings.definition: A situation in which two companies dominate a particular market or industry.
meanings.sent1: In the duopoly of the soda market, only two companies control everything.
meanings.sent2: The duopoly in the tech industry makes it hard for new companies to compete.
meanings.sent3: The duopoly of the ice cream market led to a fierce battle between the two companies.
meanings.sent4: Their duopoly over the music streaming services gave them immense power.
meanings.sent5: The duopoly of the car manufacturing industry was finally broken by a new innovative company.

meanings.definition: The market condition that exists when there are only two sellers.
meanings.sent1: The duopoly in the fruit stand meant only two sellers were offering apples.
meanings.sent2: In the duopoly of the lemonade stand, competition was limited to just two sellers.
meanings.sent3: The duopoly of the toy store made it a fun challenge for the two sellers to attract customers.
meanings.sent4: Their duopoly over the vegetable market made them the go-to sellers for fresh produce.
meanings.sent5: The duopoly of the bookstore made it tough for other sellers to enter the market.
